# cgImage()

**Instance Method**

Returns the texture’s image data as a Quartz 2D image.

## Declaration

```swift
func cgImage() -> CGImage
```

## Discussion

The [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKTexture/cgImage()] property returns the contents of a texture as a Quartz Image.

As an example use, you can create an image from a portion of your scene and save it to disk by doing the following:

1. Use the [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKView/texture(from:)] method to render the scene’s contents to a texture.
2. Call [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKTexture/cgImage()] on the result.
3. Use [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/ImageIO/CGImageDestination] to write the `CGImage` out to disk.
